Supports light and dark mode.

plugins.name: Color Palette Extractor
plugins.description:
Easily audit and document your color palette. This plugin scans any selection, extracts all solid colors and gradients, and lists them with their official Variable or Style name.

Get instant access to HEX (with alpha), RGBA and HLS codes, and export the entire list to an HTML file, perfect for creating style guides and improving developer handoff.
plugins.tagline: Extracts colors, codes, and names from your selection. Lets you export the palette to HTML

plugins.name: Frameverse
plugins.description:
Frameverse - Share Frames Seamlessly


Frameverse is a powerful Figma plugin that revolutionizes design sharing. Generate secure tokens for your frames and assets, allowing instant access across teams and continents. Share specific design elements without exposing your entire file, maintaining control while enabling seamless collaboration.



âœ¨ Key Features


- One-Click Sharing: Select any frame, section, or slice and generate a shareable token instantly

- Smart Import: Paste a token to import frames with perfect fidelity, maintaining all properties including:

- Layout structures and constraints

- Shapes and component instances

- Vector paths and effects

- Fonts and text styles

- Images and fills


- Batch Operations: Share or import multiple frames at once

- Preview Panel: Visual preview of selected frames before sharing



ğŸ¯ Perfect For


- Design System Teams sharing component updates

- Agencies sharing design patterns with clients

- Product Teams maintaining consistent layouts across files

- Anyone looking to transfer frames between files without manual recreation



ğŸ’¡ How It Works


1. Select the frames you want to share

2. Click "Generate Token" to create a unique share code

3. Share the token with your team

4. Recipients paste the token to import frames with all properties intact (Eg: YJS-hoo)



ğŸ”’ Security & Performance


- Tokens are temporary and expire after 24 hours

- No data persistence - files are fully purged after token expiration

- Share specific frames without exposing entire files

- Intelligent compression and processing for optimal performance

- Progressive loading for larger frames



No account required. Start sharing frames in seconds!



Questions or feedback? Contact us

plugins.name: Eggstractor
plugins.description:
Design-to-code, simplified


Eggstractor is a Figma plugin that exports designs as SCSS mixins, allowing developers to build components their way while keeping styling updates seamless. By separating structure from styling, Eggstractor ensures that design changes donâ€™t disrupt component architecture. And with automated code generation for updates, dramatically speed up iteration and reduce development overhead.


Designers: Easily update component designs and push them directly to codeâ€”no developer implementation needed.


Developers: Maintain full control over component structure while receiving Figma-driven style updates as branched pull requests for review before merging.


For an end-to-end setup and demo, check out our Getting Started Guide.


How It Works

  1. Connect to your GitHub repo.
  2. Structure your coded components to use SCSS mixins.
  3. When designs change in Figma, run the plugin to generate updated SCSS mixins.
  4. Review, then click to create a pull request.
  5. A developer reviews and merges, and the changes are live.


Current Status

Eggstractor is actively in development. While not all CSS properties are supported yet, our roadmap includes full support for core CSS properties, followed by an open-source design system built to leverage Eggstractor.


Eggstractor is an open source project by Bitovi. Contributions are welcome! Get involved at github.com/bitovi/eggstractor.


Need some help?

Check out our Getting Started Guide.


Need more help?

Chat with us on Discord | Send GitHub feature requests | Email to support@bitovi.com


Need pros to help design & build your design system or app? Thatâ€™s Bitovi!

plugins.name: Codex â€” Repository-Aware Code Generator powered by AI
plugins.description:
Codex is an AI powered code generator that learns your existing repo. You can import your repository, and Codex will generate code in your used framework, using your styles and configurations. It works with any framework or language. No setup necessary â€” just import with one click and go!


Features


Code just like you wrote it yourself

Codex will adapt its code generation to the conventions and code style used across your repo. It will read config files and use the same libraries and frameworks you use in your project.


Refine your export further

Need to use a specific component? Instruct Codex to change your code and get a refined result, without losing the context. You can also do this multiple times, until youâ€™re 100% happy.


Learns your repository with a one-click-import

You donâ€™t have to map your figma components to your design system. Codex automatically recognizes which components you have implemented or installed and will use those for generating code.


Generates code in any framework or language

Any language, library or framework you are using in your repo will be used by Codex to generate code from Figma.


Learns from your feedback

As you refine your exports, Codex will remember your feedback and apply it to future code generations.


FAQ


Who is it for?

Codex is targeted at professional front end developers to speed up their workflows.


Does my figma file need special preparation?

No, but it works much better if all frames use auto layout.


Which frameworks are supported?

Codex is framework-agnostic. This means it can generate code in any language, for any framework. However, popular frameworks like React and Vue work best, as LLMs have more training data on them.


Can I use it without a repository?

Currently, no. But you can create a repository and initialize it with an empty skeleton in the framework of your choice, then Codex will generate code for that framework.


Does it work with monorepos?

If there is only one frontend package in the repo, likely yes. Better monorepo support is on the roadmap.


Does it only work in dev mode/design mode?

Codex works in both figma modes.


Does it only work with Github?

Currently, yes. Other providers coming soon.


Pricing


Check our pricing page for information on plans.
plugins.tagline: The code generator that understands your repository

plugins.name: MGS Composer - Exporter
plugins.description:
Export your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project

Streamline your design workflow with the MGS Composer Exporter. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design environment and MGS Composer, enabling you to create stunning user interfaces in Figma and transfer them to Composer for further development.


Features

Automatic Asset Generation: Composer generates assets automatically from the exported data, saving time and effort.

Preserved Design Hierarchy: Composer mirrors Figma's design tree as closely as possible, ensuring an accurate translation of your design.

Component Support: Assets generated from Figma Components are treated as a shared resource, saving memory on your target device.


Detailed Guide


How to Use:

  1. Install the Plugin: Add it to your Figma workspace.
  2. Run the Plugin: An export window will appear on the right side of Figma's interface.
  3. Select Page: Navigate to the page you want to export from and click Select Page.
  4. Mark Objects for Export: The export window will list top-level objects. These will be translated to Screens in Composer. Select objects by clicking on them or their children in the Figma design, which will automatically mark them in the export window.
  5. Set Export Options: After selecting objects, choose from two options:
  6. Flatten Group Components during export: Flattens groups into a single image in the exported data.
  7. Export all primitives as .svg assets: Exports vectors like rectangles, lines, and text as SVG assets.
  8. Generate Data: Click the Generate Data button. The export window will show a view of all exported objects and a corresponding JSON file. You can add custom properties to the objects here in the upper view.
  9. Export File: Click the Export button at the bottom of the window and select a location to save the file.
  10. Open MGS Composer: Launch Composer and create a new design or open an existing one with a screen size adequate for your Figma content.
  11. Import Project: In Composer, go to "File > Import" and select Figma Composer Project. Confirm the prompt that appears.
  12. Done: Composer will import the file and add new screens, assets, and widgets to your design.


Support & Feedback:

MGS User Guide

MGS Forum
plugins.tagline: Exports your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project.

plugins.name: Token Swapper
plugins.description:
To use it, simply activate the plugin, import any component from any library, and it does the rest! ğŸš€


https://www.loom.com/share/6d526c11f63644318e9c604193e11e3d


Effortless Token Swapping Across Files

Swap Design Tokens between your design system and working files in seconds. Maintain consistency without duplicating libraries or styles.


Full-page Token Replacement

Need to update a full design with new tokens? One click with "Swap All" updates every node, text style, and color variable instantly â€” no manual work required.


Intelligent Scan & Replace

Automatically scan files for elements not linked to tokens â€” including colors and fonts â€” and batch replace them with variables from your design system. Eliminate inconsistencies with a few clicks.


Cross-theme & Project Flexibility

Manage multiple projects with a single design system source. Token Swapper ensures all visual assets remain connected to their proper tokens, even across brands or themes.


Non-destructive Workflow

Token Swapper doesnâ€™t overwrite or break your original styles. Switch between token sets and preview changes without permanent commitment â€” perfect for testing themes or migrating designs.


Smart Query Processing

Let the plugin process bulk token changes in the background. Your edits persist even when closing the plugin, making large updates smoother and safer.


Beta Features: More Power, More Control

Our beta tools let you go even deeper â€” manage font tokens, swap icons, and process entire pages. Just stay in the same token session for best results while we keep improving.


FAQs

Does this work with free Figma plans?

Yes! Token Swapper is fully compatible with all Figma plans â€” free included. No need for professional tiers to keep your tokens in sync.


What if I use my own token naming system?

Thatâ€™s okay! As long as your token names and structure match across files, Token Swapper will recognize and replace them intelligently.


Why use Token Swapper instead of doing it manually?

Manual token swaps are time-consuming, error-prone, and hard to scale. Token Swapper automates the entire process, saving you hours of work and ensuring consistency.

plugins.name: BulkGen
plugins.description:
BulkGen figma plugin saves you hundreds of hours of doing grunt work. If you're tasked with creating the same design, lots of time with just some data changing â€” don't wast time doing it manually. Just use bulkgen, it can auto populate your figma designs from a Google Sheet.


Features:

  1. Google Sheet Import: Make sure these are set to public.
  2. CSV Import: Works for local files


How it Works:

  1. Paste your Google Sheets URL
  2. Make sure the dynamic layers in Figma are labelled correctly (ex: firstname would be #firstname)
  3. Select a base template and hit generate, it's that easy.


Use Cases:

  1. Event Banners: Doing the same event in many cities? This will work for that

plugins.name: Adapture by INKR
plugins.description:
Adapture makes it easy to adapt your designs for new marketsâ€”right inside Figma. By understanding your content and layout, it rewrites and translates text that fits seamlessly into your design and speaks to your audience.


No broken layouts, no manual fixesâ€”just content that works.


Why Designers Love Adapture:


  1. Effortless Adaptation: Select your frames, set your goals, and let Adapture handle the rest. It rewrites and translates text while keeping your layout intact.
  2. Smarter Translations: Adapture analyzes your design and messaging to deliver text that matches the tone, intent, and purpose of your work.
  3. Consistent Messaging: Whether youâ€™re creating for new audiences or adapting for different markets, Adapture helps you keep your messaging aligned and on-brand.
  4. Saves Time: Automates the heavy lifting so you can focus on creating, not fixing.


Key Features:


  1. Design-Aware Adaptation: Adapture understands your designs and rewrites text to fit your layout, intent, and audience.
  2. Cultural Customization: Adapt for new markets with sensitivity to language, tone, and local nuances.
  3. Built for Designers: Works right inside Figma, so you can adapt and update designs without disrupting your workflow.
  4. Seamless Integration: Keeps your layouts clean and intact, saving you time and effort.


Perfect For:


  1. Designers creating multilingual or culturally tailored content.
  2. Teams expanding into new markets or working across global audiences.
  3. Anyone who wants to streamline design adaptation without sacrificing quality.


----

Currently in Closed Beta


Adapture is available in closed beta. You can request an invitation code directly from the plugin to start adapting your designs today.

plugins.name: FlipArabic
plugins.description:
Flip frames, change fonts, and translate copy for Arabic layouts. All with one click.

Let FlipArabic handle localization so you can focus on crafting great experiences.


Made for Your Workflow

  1. Save Time - No hours wasted on manual mirroring or font hunting.
  2. Zero Learning Curve - Select a frame or whole sections for multiple frames and convert!
  3. No Details Lost - Padding, nested auto-layouts, absolute elements, and constraints are all taken care of.
  4. Built-in Translation - AI-powered translation that keeps copy in context (big updates coming in this space).
  5. Smart Font Swapping - Auto-matches weights & styles when exact alternatives aren't available.
  6. Smart Skip for Visuals - Icons, logos, shapes, SVGs & flags keep their original direction.


Fine Tune Your Conversion

  1. Add df or don't flip to layer names to skip flipping
  2. Add dfc or don't flip content to frame names to flip position but keep contents unchanged
  3. Add dt or don't translate to text layer names to keep specific text in English
  4. Add dtc or don't translate content to parent frame names to preserve entire text blocks


For support, ideas or general feedback, reach out to fliparabic@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Convert your English designs to Arabic instantly. Flip, change fonts & translate in one click.

plugins.name: Fill Cleaner
plugins.description:
Fill Cleaner helps you maintain clean, efficient Figma files by removing redundant fills from layers. Whether itâ€™s multiple image fills, solid colors, or gradients, the plugin preserves only the topmost fill of each typeâ€”no visual changes, just a lighter file.


âœ¨ Smart Fill Cleaning

  1. Image fills: Keep the topmost image
  2. Color fills: Remove redundant solids
  3. Gradient fills: Retain just the top gradient
  4. CMD+K for quick commands
  5. Batch cleaning: Works on selections or entire pages

  1. Instantly apply images to selected layers
  2. Great for refreshing mockups and prototypes

  2. File optimization: Reduce size, speed up performance

plugins.name: IconBridge â€“ Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that automates icon exports, optimizes assets, and pushes them directly to GitHubâ€”seamlessly integrating design and development. IconBridge eliminates manual file handling, ensuring every icon is correctly formatted, optimized, and instantly available for development.



âœ¨ Key Features


  1. Optimized Icon Export â€“ Export icons directly from Figma with automatic light/dark version generation for multi-colored icons.
  2. Seamless GitHub Integration â€“ Push icons directly from Figma to GitHub, with automated organization and validation.
  3. Automated Pull Request Creation â€“ IconBridge commits and opens a GitHub PR automatically, streamlining the handoff process.
  4. Secure Repository Access â€“ Uses GitHub authentication to ensure private and controlled icon handoff.




ğŸš€ How to Use


Quick & Optimized Icon Export

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click â€œExport Iconsâ€ on the home screen.
  3. IconBridge automatically optimizes each icon, ensuring clean, lightweight SVGs.
  4. Click â€œSaveâ€ to download optimized icons directly to your device.


Automated Handoff to GitHub

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click â€œExport to GitHubâ€ to begin the automation.
  3. IconBridge optimizes and validates each icon before uploading.
  4. Automatically organizes icons in the correct repository folder.
  5. Creates a pull request automatically, ready for developer review.




ğŸ› ï¸ What Youâ€™ll Need

  1. A Figma project with icons.
  2. A GitHub repository for automated exports.




ğŸ”’ Secure & Seamless Workflow

IconBridge ensures a secure, efficient, and automated handoff process:


  1. Direct Figma-to-GitHub integrationâ€”no external storage needed.
  2. Authentication with GitHub to keep your repository secure.
  3. Fully automated workflowâ€”eliminating manual exports, uploads, and PR creation.


ğŸš€ Forget tedious icon managementâ€”let IconBridge automate everything from Figma to production!
plugins.tagline: Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub

plugins.name: PropSelect
plugins.description:
PropSelect enhances your Figma workflow by allowing you to copy and paste specific properties like fill, stroke, and corner radius between elements without overwriting all properties.


Here is a YouTube video summarizing the features and working of this plugin - https://youtu.be/76v9z9xthH0


How it works:

1. Select an element: Click on an element in your design, and its properties will appear in the plugin UI.

2. Choose properties to copy: For each property (e.g., fill, stroke, corner radius), you can select a checkbox to indicate which properties you want to copy. Once you're done, click the copy button to save the selected properties.

3. Paste properties: You can paste the copied properties onto one or more elements at once.


Features:

â€¢ Selective property copying: Choose exactly which properties to copy (e.g., fill, stroke, corner radius) to avoid overwriting unwanted styles.

â€¢ Multi-object pasting: Apply copied properties to multiple objects simultaneously, saving time when working with multiple elements.

â€¢ Compatibility with other methods: You can paste properties copied outside of the plugin directly. Copying properties within plugin will not override that.

â€¢ Undo support: Easily undo your last action if something goes wrong.


Tips:

â€¢ Use PropSelect to quickly replicate specific properties across multiple objects without affecting other styles.

â€¢ Perfect for maintaining consistency in your design while only changing the properties you care about.

â€¢ Works well for batch edits where you want to adjust specific properties, like color or stroke width, across many elements.


Known issues:

â€¢ Does not copy underline properties or text alignment.

â€¢ Will not work on text boxes with different properties applied to individual contents.
plugins.tagline: Copy and paste specific properties of anÂ element

137698.release_notes:
This version includes 2 major updates - 
1. Initially, on copying a property having a 'style' only the raw value of style was getting copied. Now, it will copy the style itself. E.g. on copying a element with fill style `Black`, the value of that style i.e. #000000 was getting copied which is now fixed to paste `Black` as fill style.
2. The stroke property initially did not capture stroke stroke direction (all sides/ top/ left/ custom, etc) and would apply it on all sides. Fixed

Please let me know if you find any bugs or have suggestions to improve.

plugins.name: Grid Counter
plugins.description: Grid Counter calculates how many grid columns or rows a selected element spans within its parent frame. You can also adjust the grid columns with a click of a button.

plugins.name: Silent Sweep
plugins.description:
Silent Sweep is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly managing concealed elements in your designs. This powerful tool scans your current page, revealing all hidden layers within each frame and artboard.

With its intuitive card-based interface, you can quickly identify and select hidden elements, streamlining your cleanup process.


Key Features:


  1. Instant Detection: Automatically finds all hidden layers on your current page.
  2. Organized View: Displays hidden layers grouped by their parent frames for easy navigation.
  3. Selective Cleanup: Choose which hidden layers to remove with simple checkboxes.
  4. Real-time Updates: Refreshes automatically when you switch pages or make changes.
  5. Efficient Workflow: Helps maintain clean, organized Figma files without tedious manual searching.


Whether you're polishing up a final design or inheriting a complex file, Silent Sweep helps you maintain a tidy workspace. Say goodbye to forgotten hidden layers and hello to cleaner, more manageable Figma projects. Simplify your design process and boost your productivity with Silent Sweep â€“ your personal cleanup assistant in Figma

plugins.name: EasyMemo
plugins.description:
EasyMemo is a versatile plugin for creating, editing, and managing text memos within Figma. With EasyMemo, you can easily add colorful sticky notes, shapes with text, and simple text nodes to your canvas, helping to keep your workspace organized.


Key Features:


Memo Creation and Editing: Simply enter your text, select your desired memo type, and create memos effortlessly. You can edit memos directly on the canvas, and updates are reflected in real-time.

Customizable Colors: Choose colors from a preset color palette, allowing you to categorize and prioritize memos. The text color automatically adjusts for optimal readability based on the selected background color.

Easy Management:


Organize Memos in a List: Add memos to a list for better organization. You can update or delete memo texts directly from the list. The list is scrollable and always up-to-date.

Batch Generation: Easily generate all listed memos at once. Just click the "Create Shapes" button, and all memos will be neatly arranged on the canvas.

Efficient Layout: Memos are generated in the center of the viewport, focusing on the most relevant areas. They are neatly arranged to avoid overlap.

User-Friendly Interface: The modern and intuitive design features a clearly laid-out text input area, radio buttons for selecting memo types, a color palette, and a dynamically updating list.

How to Use:


Enter Text: Input your memo content in the text input area.

Select Memo Type: Choose from shapes with text, simple text, or sticky notes using the radio buttons.

Pick a Color: Select a color from the palette to categorize your memos. The selected color applies to the memo background, and the text color adjusts automatically.

Add to List: Press the Enter key to add the memo to the list. You can edit or delete memos directly within the list.

Generate Memos: Click the "Create Shapes" button to generate all memos on the canvas at once. Memos are centered in the viewport and neatly arranged.

EasyMemo is the perfect tool for organizing ideas and feedback within your Figma projects. Whether brainstorming, planning, or collaborating, EasyMemo simplifies memo management and supports you efficiently.

plugins.name: strings_repository
plugins.description:
Simple plugin to synchronise translations with strings repository. Allows to push and pull translations from your own server. Works with active selection to speedup parsing processes.


Usage:

Enter connection details and press connect button.

After selection of element press "refresh selection" to get text labels from selection.

Press "pull" to fetch translations from remote server.

Press "apply" to apply translations from selected translations to document selection.

Press "push" to send translations to remote server.
